sn1.32:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
sn1.32:4.2: Then, late at night, several beautiful gods of the Satullapa Group, lighting up the entire Jeta’s Grove, went up to the Buddha,
sn1.32:4.3: bowed, and stood to one side.
sn1.32:4.4: Standing to one side, one deity recited this verse in the Buddha’s presence:
sn1.32:6.1: Then another deity recited these verses in the Buddha’s presence:
sn1.32:7.1: “When a miser fails to give because of fear,
sn1.32:7.2: the very thing they’re afraid of comes to pass.
sn1.32:7.6: in this world and the next.
sn1.32:8.2: overcoming that stain, and give a gift.
sn1.32:8.3: The good deeds of sentient beings
sn1.32:8.4: support them in the next world.”
sn1.32:9.1: Then another deity recited these verses in the Buddha’s presence:
sn1.32:10.1: “Among the dead they do not die,
sn1.32:10.2: who, like fellow travelers on the road,
sn1.32:10.3: are happy to provide, though they have but little.
sn1.32:11.1: Some who have little are happy to provide,
sn1.32:11.2: while some who have much don’t wish to give.
sn1.32:12.1: Then another deity recited these verses in the Buddha’s presence:
sn1.32:13.3: the wicked don’t act like this,
sn1.32:13.4: for the teaching of the good is hard to follow.
sn1.32:14.1: That’s why the virtuous and the wicked
sn1.32:14.2: have different destinations after leaving this place.
sn1.32:14.4: while the virtuous are bound for heaven.”
sn1.32:15.1: Then another deity said to the Buddha:
sn1.32:16.1: “You’ve all spoken well in your own way. However, listen to me also:
sn1.32:17.1: A hundred thousand people making a thousand sacrifices
sn1.32:17.3: of one who lives rightly, wandering for gleanings,
sn1.32:17.4: or one who supports their partner from what little they have.”
sn1.32:18.1: Then another deity addressed the Buddha in verse:
sn1.32:19.1: “Why doesn’t that sacrifice of theirs, so abundant and magnificent,
sn1.32:19.2: equal the value of a moral person’s gift?
sn1.32:19.3: How is it that a hundred thousand people making a thousand sacrifices
sn1.32:19.4: isn’t worth a fraction of what’s offered by such a person?”
sn1.32:20.4: in no way equals the value of a moral person’s gift.
sn1.32:21.1: That’s how is it that a hundred thousand people making a thousand sacrifices
sn1.32:21.2: isn’t worth a fraction of what’s offered by such a person.”
